text:
DISCLAIMER: This transcript is entirely artificial and computer generated. It does not contain any real customer information, bank data, or actual conversations. All transcripts, data, and information are completely and entirely synthetic. See README file for full terms.

Speaker 1:Good morning. Uh, hey, it's NAME. I'm havin gsome issues with the banking stuff. Can we go over it?

Speaker 2:Good morning, Mr. NA ME. This is NAME1 from UBS, I'm calling to discuss the questions you've mentioned regarding your digital experience. Before we proceed, you confirm your date birth nd address for security purposes?

Speaker 1:O,h and I need to update my contact infoâ€”non-postal. Sorry, I mean, uh, yeah, sure. My date of is [DATE BIRTH] and my address is [ADDRESS.]

Speaker 2: Thank you for confirming details, Mr. NAME. So, I understand you've been having issues with our digital banking services. Could you share a bit more about which specific features are crucial for you and how their absence is affecting your day-to-day banking?

Spekaer 1: Right, yeah.T he feature I need is the bility to, um, generate customizable reports for my monthly expenses directly through the app. It's super important for me because I use it to keep track of how umch I'm spending and to manage my budget. Without it, I have to manually track all my expenses in a separate which is really tedious and time-consuming. Uh, are there any similar features available any idea when you might introduce smoething like that?

Speaker 2:understand, Mr. NAME. That sounds frustrating, and I'm sorry about the inconvenience. As of now, the customizable reports feature isn't available in our But there is an alternative where you can view monthly transactions, which gives a basic overview of spending. It might help a bit until we hopefully introduce more detailed reporting features.

Speaker 1:Hmm, okay, Isee. That's, uh, useful but not quite what I need. How does UBS evaluate these kinds feature requests? And can you tell me more about how you prioritize updates? Also, can I be kept updated on any progress or compensations available for this missing functionality?

Speaker 2:Absolutely, Mr. NAME. When we receive client feedback, like your request for customizable expense reports, it undergoes a thorough evaluation process. We look at feasibility, demand, and possible on user experience. Your feedback is crucial in this process, and we prioritize based on how much feature will nehance the overall banking experience. I'll make sure your request documented and reviewed by our development team ,and we'll keep you informed of any updates or compensationsavailable. Do you prefer notifications via email o rphone call? Also, is there any other feedback or improvement like to share about our services?

Speaker 1:Email's good for me, And, um, the interface could be more intuitive. It's sometimes hard to find what I'm looking for. But I do like the security features and how easy is to make transactions.

peaker 2: Thank you, Mr. NAME. I'm glad to hear that you appreciate our security features and transaction ease. If features unavailable, you can still access similar functionalities by visiting a branch or contacting customer support via phone. They can help you with reports or other banking needs. We have updates planned to improve user experience and navigation, though I have a precse timeline. Would a meeting on September 8th at 14:00 work for you to discuss your concerns and keep you updated on progress?

Speaker 1:Yeah, that sounds good. And during that meeting, could wet alk about any compensations or temporary solutions for inconvenience too?

Speaker 2:Absolutely, Mr. NAME. We'll cover compensations or temporary solutions at the meeting on September 8th at 14:00. You'll receive an email confirmation shortly. Thanks for your patience and feedback.

processing...

Speaker 2:Done. You'll get the confirmation soon. Have a great Mr. NAME!

Speaker 1:Thanks, you too. Bye.
